document.masterDocTitle: Descriptions of mature larvae and pupae of the genus Larinus (Coleoptera: Curculionidae, Lixinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Descriptions of mature larvae and pupae of the genus Larinus (Coleoptera: Curculionidae, Lixinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material. (
11 larvae
of different larval instars,
7 pupae
), collected in flower heads of spotted knapweed (
Centaurea stoebe
L.) growing in psammophilous grass communities: POLAND centr. or., Wołczyny ad Włodawa, UTM nets: FC
80, 28
.viii. 2008 (
4 larvae
,
3 pupae
); Stare Stulno ad Włodawa, UTM nets: FC
80, 28
.viii. 2008 (
3 larvae
,
1 pupa
), all R. Gosik leg; collected in flower heads of wig knapweed (
Centaurea phrygia
L.) growing in meadow under mountains: ROMANIA , prov. Alba , Rimetea, 33 km S of Cluj, Bachufer,
N 46 ° 28 ' 57 "
,
E 23 ° 34 ' 64 "
, 480 m a.s.l.,
21 .vii. 2008
(
4 larvae
,
3 pupae
), J. Skuhrovec leg.
Description of mature larva. COLORATION. Head light brown or brown. All thoracic and abdominal segments white or gray. Cuticle minutely spiculated.

Labrum (
Fig. 4
—left side) approx. 2 times as wide as long, with 3 pairs of long, bacilliform lrms , of different length; lrms 3 shorter than lrms 1 and lrms 2 , all lrms placed distinctly on protuberances; anterior margin double sinuate. Clypeus (
Fig. 4
—left side) 3.2 times as wide as long with 2 long, bacilliform cls , unequal in length, localized posterolaterad; anterior margin slightly rounded to the inside; median part covered by thorn-shaped cuticular processes. Epipharynx (
Fig. 4
—right side) with 5 pairs of blunt, finger-like als , different in length; 2 pairs of ams , ams 1 distinctly longer than ams 2 ; 2 pairs of short, blunt mes ; labral rods ( lr ) elongated, converging anteriad. Mandibles (
Fig. 5
) slightly truncate; mds short, hairform. Maxilla (
Fig. 6
) stipes with 1 stps , 2 pfs and 1 malar basiventral s. ( mbs ), equal in length; mala with 10 bacilliform dms of different length; vms 1-2 short, almost equal in length; vms distinctly shorter than dms . Maxillary palpi with two palpomeres; basal palpomere with 1 mxps and two pores; length ratio of basal and distal palpomeres: 1 :0.8; distal palpomere with a group of 6 long, conical, cuticular apical processes. Praelabium (
Fig. 7
) heart-shaped, with 1 pair of plbs ; ligula with sinuate margin and 3 pairs of hairform micro ligs , equal in length; premental sclerite well visible. Labial palpi with two palpomeres; length ratio of basal and distal palpomeres: 1 :0.5; distal palpomere with 4 short, cuticular apical processes; basal palpomere with 1 dorsal pore. Postlabium (
Fig. 7
) with 3 pslbs , different in length, the first pair localized anteriorly, remaining two pairs laterally.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–7.
Larinus obtusus
mature larva head, antenna and mouth parts: 1—dorsal view, 2—lateral view ( des —dorsal epicranial s., fs —frontal s., les —lateral epicranial s., ves —ventral epicranial s., at —antenna), 3—antenna, 4 (left side)— labrum and clypeus ( cls —clypeal s., lrms —labral s.), 4 (right side) epipharynx ( ams —anteromedial s., als —anterolateral s., mes —median s., lr —labral rods), 5—right mandible ( mds —mandible dorsal s.), 6—left maxilla, dorsal view ( dms —dorsally malae s., vms —ventrally malae s., mxps —maxillary palps s., pfs —palpiferal s., stps —stipal s., mbs —malar basiventral s.), 7— praelabium and postlabium, ventral aspect ( plbs —prelabial s., pslbs —postlabial s., ligs —ligular s.).

FIGURES 8–11.
Larinus obtusus
mature larva habitus: 8—lateral view, 9—lateral view of thoracic segments, 10—lateral view of abdominal segment II., 11—lateral view of abdominal segments VIII–X ( prns —pronotal s., dpls —dorsopleural s., vpls — ventropleural s., prs —prodorsal s., pds —postdorsal s., pda —pedal s., as —alar s., ss —spicular s., dls —dorsolateral s., lsts — laterosternal s., msts —mesosternal s., sts —sternal s., ls —lateral s., ds —dorsal s.).

FIGURES 12–14.
Larinus obtusus
pupa habitus: 12—ventral view, 13—dorsal view, 14—lateral view ( pc —pseudocerci, sas —super apical s., ls —lateral s., sls —super lateral s., ds —discal s., pls —posterolateral s., vs —vertical s., sos —super orbital s., os —orbital s., pas —postantennal s., rs —rostral s., mts —mandibular thecae s, fes —femoral s.).
